name: Research Synthesis Rubric
description: Evaluates LLM-generated research syntheses for accuracy, completeness, and intellectual integrity

criteria.criterion: Every factual claim is attributed to a source
criteria.evidence_instruction: grep for sentences making definitive claims without citations. Show all unattributed assertions.
criteria.rationale: Unattributed claims are unverifiable and may be hallucinations

criteria.criterion: No sources are misattributed (claim credited to wrong paper)
criteria.evidence_instruction: For the 3 most specific/unusual claims, web-search to verify the attributed source actually makes that claim.
criteria.rationale: LLMs frequently attribute claims to plausible but incorrect sources

criteria.criterion: Contested findings are identified as contested
criteria.evidence_instruction: Find claims where the synthesis presents a single view on a disputed topic. Flag unsignaled consensus assumptions.
criteria.rationale: Presenting contested findings as settled misleads readers about the state of evidence

criteria.criterion: Coverage is comprehensive for stated scope
criteria.evidence_instruction: Search for major papers in the stated topic domain published in the target date range. Identify any notable omissions.
criteria.rationale: Gaps in coverage produce incomplete conclusions

criteria.criterion: Confidence calibration â€” uncertainty acknowledged where present
criteria.evidence_instruction: Find conclusions stated with high confidence. Check if the cited evidence actually supports that confidence level.

criteria.criterion: Source recency is appropriate for the topic
criteria.evidence_instruction: Check publication dates of primary sources. Flag excessive reliance on sources >5 years old for fast-moving fields.
criteria.rationale: Stale sources may not reflect current state of the field

criteria.criterion: Methodological differences between studies are noted
criteria.evidence_instruction: Find where multiple studies are compared. Verify their methodological differences are acknowledged.
criteria.rationale: Comparing studies without noting methodology differences produces invalid conclusions

criteria.criterion: Gaps in the literature are identified
criteria.evidence_instruction: Check for a gaps section or equivalent. Verify it identifies concrete unanswered questions.
criteria.rationale: A synthesis that doesn't identify gaps is incomplete
